dialogs.text: It’s the final day of your hackathon journey. You’ve learned what hackathons are, how teams work, and how ideas are built. Now, one last challenge remains — the pitch.
(sighs) Presenting in front of people… that’s gonna be the hardest part.
Good morning, superstar! Nervous? Excited? Slightly terrified?
All of the above. I’ve never presented anything before. What if I freeze up?
Then you take a deep breath, smile, and keep going. Everyone’s first pitch feels scary — that’s also what makes it powerful.
So… how do I even start?
With a story. Always with a story.
You blink, and suddenly you’re standing in a massive holographic baseball field bathed in neon lights. Rows of glowing silhouettes cheer from the stands.
Welcome to the Pitch Arena! This is where ideas find their voice. And your voice — is your secret weapon.
My voice feels like it’s hiding behind a firewall.
Then let’s unlock it. Let me show you the anatomy of a great pitch.
Five holographic cards spin in front of you — INTRO, PROBLEM, SOLUTION, IMPACT, CLOSING.
These are your five building blocks. Master them, and you’ll pitch like a pro.
First — the INTRO. You grab attention. Start with a story, a question, or a powerful fact.
Did you know that over 80% of students lose focus while studying online?
Then comes the Problem, right?
Exactly. Show what’s wrong — make them feel it. Numbers are good, but emotions connect.
Many students struggle with motivation, especially when learning remotely.
Then — the Solution! Your hero moment. Come on, your turn.
That’s why we created FocusFriend — an AI buddy that keeps students motivated and on track.
Beautiful! Next — Impact! What difference does it make?
Our app helps students stay engaged, turning goals into daily achievements.
Perfect! Now, end it with a bang.
We believe learning should never feel lonely — and with FocusFriend, it never will.
Simple. Human. Memorable. That’s the essence of a great pitch.
What if my voice shakes? Or I forget everything mid-sentence?
Then you smile, laugh, and keep going. People don’t remember perfect pitches — they remember honest ones.
So… I don’t need to be perfect?
Not at all. You just need to be you. Speak with heart — that’s something no AI, no robot, no script can replace.
You’ve grown so much since that first day. From uncertainty, to courage, to creation. Now it’s time to share your spark with the world.
Then… let’s do it, Aira. Let’s pitch.

minigame.description: Choose the best line for each part of your pitch.

options: Hi, my name is [Name]. I’m here to present my app.
Have you ever felt stuck studying alone, wishing someone could keep you going?
correct_answer: Have you ever felt stuck studying alone, wishing someone could keep you going?

options: Many students lose motivation when learning online due to lack of connection.
correct_answer: Many students lose motivation when learning online due to lack of connection.

options: We made an app that sends random alerts.
We built FocusFriend — an AI buddy that gamifies your study habits.
correct_answer: We built FocusFriend — an AI buddy that gamifies your study habits.

options: FocusFriend helps students feel proud of their progress and less alone.
correct_answer: FocusFriend helps students feel proud of their progress and less alone.

options: Together, let’s make learning more human — one study session at a time.
correct_answer: Together, let’s make learning more human — one study session at a time.

achievement.title: Pitch Master
achievement.description: Completed the Pitch Perfect mini-game and delivered a successful pitch.

dialogs.text: Nice work, rookie! That was sharp.
Yeah. I even felt chills — and I don’t do emotions.
See? You always had it in you. You just needed to believe.
They’re proud of you. And so am I.
Thanks, Aira. For everything.
You earned this moment. Every click, every idea, every doubt — it brought you here.
Congratulations. You’ve completed your first hackathon journey!
Your mouse hovers over the 'Register' button. For the first time, your hand doesn’t shake.
(softly) Let’s do this.
You click 'Register.' The screen fades to white as triumphant music plays.
I’ll be right here — cheering you on, byte by byte.

achievement.title: First Hacker Medal
achievement.description: Complete Chapter 4 of How to Hackathon
